headline.main: ARGENTINE NEWS MEN HARASS PRESS PARLEY

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: SHIPPING--MAILS; ALL HOURS GIVEN IN EASTERN STANDARD TIME

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 9--The problem of what to do about the representatives of fortyone Argentine publications who had solicited membership in the Inter-American Press Association just before the opening of its annual conference here yesterday...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 9--The problem of what to do about the representatives of fortyone Argentine publications who had solicited membership in the Inter-American Press Association just before the opening of its annual conference here yesterday was solved today by the applicants themselves.
docs.abstract: Collapses at Inter-Amer Press Conf, Montevideo

headline.main: PERONIST EDITORS QUIT AREA PARLEY; Walk Out of Inter-American Press Talks--Say They Will Form 'Non-Yankee' Body

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: SHIPPING--MAILS; ALL HOURS GIVEN IN EASTERN STANDARD TIME

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 10--The Western Hemisphere's struggle for press freedom during the past year has "suffered" tragic reverses, it was reported today by a committee of the Inter-American Press Association holding its annual meeting here.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 10--The Western Hemisphere's struggle for press freedom during the past year has "suffered" tragic reverses, it was reported today by a committee of the Inter-American Press Association holding its annual meeting here.
docs.abstract: Inter-Amer Press Assn repts Argentina leads Western Hemisphere in press freedom violations

headline.main: REVERSES TO PRESS IN AMERICAS NOTED; Argentina's Actions Top List of Restrictions on Freedom Reported at Conference

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: SHIPPING--MAILS; ALL HOURS GIVEN IN EASTERN STANDARD TIME

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 11 (AP)--The Inter-American Press Association was advised today that seven Latin-American nations were taking steps to meet a newsprint shortage from their own resources. The association received two reports on the subject.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 11 (AP)--The Inter-American Press Association was advised today that seven Latin-American nations were taking steps to meet a newsprint shortage from their own resources. The association received two reports on the subject.

headline.main: LATIN AMERICANS MAP OUTPUT OF NEWSPRINT
